dialogue.string: 1�You seem lost, recruit. Tell me if there's anything you wish to know.
1�Something you'd like to know?Nothing in particular.I want to go out and fight!I want to go shopping.I want to know more about adventuring.
1�Just arrived and you're already aching to leave, eh? Listen, the land is wild beyond our gates, filled with fiends and their ilk.
1�If you must go outside, head through Ranperre Gate. Allow me to explain.
1�Right now we're on the Parade Grounds. Find the gate to the west.
1�Step through and pass the furniture store and the inn. Take the gate on the left.
1�Make another left down the stairs. You'll see Ranperre Gate beyond.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�For weapons and basic supplies, take a walk through the city and you'll find all that you need.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Recruits... Don't know which way to hold a sword and you think you're ready. Well, what would you like to know?
1�What would you like to know about?Helping people.Hunting monsters.Making easy money.Working for my country.
1�Ah, a commendable choice! I saw a lady in front of a house on Pikeman's Way who may be in need of assistance.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Novices... Don't know your own limits until a fiend beats it into your head for you. Very well. How about gathering some hides for the Tanners' Guild in Southern San d'Oria?
1�Southern San d'Oria is just beyond Victory Arch there. Pass through and go west. You'll find the Tanners' Guild soon enough.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Easy money, eh? Typical! I can't promise ease, but check the lumberyard on Laborman's Way. They should have some work for you.
1�Go through the gate to the west and pass the Phoenix Perch Inn. You should see another gate there to your right. That gate leads to Laborman's Way.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Ah, a commendable choice! Each entrance to the city has a gatehouse. Tell the guards there you wish to work for the glory of the Kingdom!
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�A gambler? Oh, you mean Varchet. He went strolling through Victory Arch just a while ago.
1�He's probably at some tavern by now. You'd best stay away from gamblers like him.
1�He was a knight, once, and always loved games of chance. They say his habit eventually cost him his knighthood.
1�Ah, a commendable choice! I saw a lady in front of a house on Pikeman's Way who may be in need of assistance.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Novices... Don't know your own limits until a fiend beats it into your head for you. Very well. How about gathering some hides for the Tanners' Guild in Southern San d'Oria?
1�Southern San d'Oria is just beyond Victory Arch there. Pass through and go west. You'll find the Tanners' Guild soon enough.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Easy money, eh? Typical! I can't promise ease, but check the lumberyard on Laborman's Way. They should have some work for you.
1�Go through the gate to the west and pass the Phoenix Perch Inn. You should see another gate there to your right. That gate leads to Laborman's Way.
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Ah, a commendable choice! Each entrance to the city has a gatehouse. Tell the guards there you wish to work for the glory of the Kingdom!
1�Should you need directions, ask those around you. Our citizens are friendly, for the most part.
1�Here, take this. It's an adventurer coupon. Give it to Matildie in front of Chateau d'Oraguille.
1�To hand items to others, select ??Trade?? from the main menu. That should be easy enough for a new recruit to understand.
1�No... That voice...You are none other than the rogue, Rochefogne!
1�You should be dead! What is the meaning of this!?
1�Why, you...
1�I need not your praise.But perhaps you may enlighten us--how do you plan to escape whilst surrounded by our Royal Knights?
1�And what if the sword you hold is not the true Lightbringer?

1�We had been expecting you all along. When your body did not turn up, we assumed that you were still out there, planning your next move. However, we did not expect that you would be posing as one of our own men.
1�Now has come the time to end your life--and the darkness that lurks about it. Come forth, O Lightbringer!
1�The Gates of Paradise...?
1�It cannot be!
1�When I removed Lightbringer from its sheathe, it felt as if I had all of Vana'diel in the palm of my hand...as if all other life on this planet was useless...
1�Then Lightbringer is not a bringer of light, but a bringer of darkness...?
1�Wait, you look familiar. But you couldn't be...
1�Rochefogne!? You were slain in the Great War!
1�That Rochefogne is a poison in our fair country. Dispatch the knights and have them comb the countryside--no, all of Vana'diel--for him!
1�But how could it be...and what could he want with the holy sword...?
1�Just a moment.
1�...I will not deny that the participation of adventurers has been of great benefit to the conquest, as well as maintained a new level of safety in the outlying regions.
1�In addition, the many treaties signed by our nations have successfully paved a path of peace. No longer need our border guards fear attacks from our friends to the south and east.
1�However, the beastman forces display no signs of weakening. Those noble guards stationed in faraway lands must deal with this reality constantly...and the burden has begun taking its toll.
1�The already large gap between the guards on our borders and the guards in the Outlands expands with each day. If nothing is done, morale shall continue to fall while discontent grows.
1�I sense that my kingdom is not alone in these worries.
1�How dare you!?
1�Hmph.And I have heard many a tale of those walking scarecrows turning on their masters...
1�Like father, like son, I say.I would not trust a lump of rubbish made by one of you lunatics any more than I would trust one of you lunatics!
1�How can one call a soldier that does not obey his leader a soldier? And how can one call a leader who cannot control his soldiers a leader?
1�Recently one of our Royal Knights made his return journey from our kingdom's territories to the north--Lord Excenmille.

1�Yes.Sword in hand, donning armor stained with the blood of a thousand foes, he returned to his homeland for the first time in twenty years...and was shocked at what he found lurking beyond its gates.

1�Foreign merchants of all shapes and sizes peddling their trinkets. Scruffy adventurers shouting out their petty problems as they walked freely among the streets and alleys. Local shopkeeps and Temple Knights laughing as they mingled with the scum washed up from all corners of the continent.
1�Excenmille was furious.
1�According to Excenmille, twenty-five years ago, a union among the children of Altana was necessary to defeat the armies of darkness.

1�However, now that the threat has gone, there is no reason for San d'Oria's citizens to be brushing shoulders with the common folk of other nations. It is this symbiotic relationship that plagues the Kingdom and keeps the once mighty red lion shackled down.
1�Excenmille's way of thinking may seem out-of-date, but his logic cannot be denied. Ever since the opening of our gates to outsiders, the quality of our knights has fallen dramatically.
1�Excenmille offered me with the following suggestion...
1�Revive Conflict!
1�That is what I propose.
1�Excellent.I look forward to meeting you all again on the battlefield.
1�Then it has been decided.Sir Wolfgang.
1�Wait, Curilla! Be not deceived! That is no father of yours!
1�Curilla!?
1�Stop, Curilla!
1�Knights, stand down!
1�Curilla, drop your sword.
1�Argh!
1�Curilla!
1�Look out!4
1�You have my word.
1�Halver...!
1�Oho! Never did I think this day would come, but I must say...my brother has the right of it.
1�Besides, were something to go amiss, the presence of   here should suffice to keep matters in hand.
1�I, too, can vouch for this, Father.
1�I have fought by  's side, and you will find no comrade more honorable.
1�The Kingdom is safe in ?[his/her] hands, Father.
1�Who goes there!?Are you oblivious to the events that are transpiring here today?
1�Coteaulepoint? What has come over you?
1�How do you know this?
1�We have Temple Knights participating in the search efforts, but there is an obvious lack of manpower.
1�I am confident they will find something.
1�What? Could it be the holy sword, Lightbringer?
1�We must report these new findings to the king immediately. This may shed some light on the whereabouts of Lightbringer.
1�I understand your words, Your Holiness, but I feel it is my duty to first report these new findings to my father.
1�Your Holiness, the Royal Knights sent to investigate the Bostaunieux Oubliette have returned. Their search turned up nothing.
1�What is that!?
1�When the great King Ranperre brought the chaos in San d'Oria under control, it is said that his admonition was carved in stone.
1�However, we cannot be sure that this tablet is King Ranperre's...
1�You say you were under orders from the papsque? I am sorry for all the trouble he may have caused you.
1�When it comes to the subject of Lightbringer, the papsque becomes a different man...
1�Where did this vagrant come from!?
1� ...I see you have same the doubts as I.
1�We would like to see the papsque in private.
1�I understand your orders. It was I who gave them.Now step aside. I will take all responsibility for any actions taken by the papsque.
1�Your...Holiness.
1�May I ask you one question? Why did you have my brother draw Lightbringer and open the Gates of Paradise?
1�But what exactly are the Gates of Paradise?
1�Lord Eald'narche?
1�Paradise lies within our hearts...
1�I will believe your words, but from this day forth, I wish to take my own path to Paradise.I pray that both our dreams be fulfilled.
1�How now, Eperdur? Often do you fraternize with adventurers of late!
1�Save the formalities. What did you ask of this adventurer?
1�I see... But should not such things be left to Bastok? I see no need for our clergy to--
1�I see. Papsque Shamonde speaks wisdom, as always. Her blessing to every land, indeed...
1�Farewell. May Paradise open its gates to us both.
1�Bold have they become of late. Some say their arm has reached as far as the Tomb of King Ranperre and Ordelle's Caves.
1�No, it is all right, Your Holiness.
1�You came to deliver the report, yes? Well, let us see it.
1�...And yet the past cannot be so readily forgotten.
1�Settle yourself, Halver.I said nothing of denying their plea.
1�It is precisely because I remember well the past that I believe the Empire's plea to be sincere.
1�It is clear this Empress Nashmeira truly intends to lead her nation to a new age.I have no doubt that she will prove a staunch ally worthy of our trust.
1�Trion! Trion!Did you not hear Rochefogne? We must send our knights immediately!
1�Who are...
1�My mother's...brother!?
1�A receipt, eh? I can't read this fancy writing. Who's it for? Prince Trion, or Prince Pieuje?
1�Who is it for?Prince Trion.Prince Pieuje.
1�All right, I'll deliver it for you. We can't let you in looking like that! Wait here.
1�I delivered the 3???? to Prince Trion. You're dismissed.
1�Imbecile! That envelope was for Prince Pieuje, not Prince Trion! Such idiocy... Get out of here!
1�All right, I'll deliver it for you. We can't let you in looking like that! Wait here.
1�I delivered the 3???? to Prince Pieuje. You're dismissed.
1�Imbecile! That envelope was for Prince Trion, not Prince Pieuje! Such idiocy... Get out of here!
1�Oh, and tell that shopkeeper to send someone respectable next time!
1�You stand before Chateau d'Oraguille. If you've no business here, begone!
1�A letter for Monarlais Halver?
1�The penmanship is atrocious...I cannot make out the addressee.
1�I have it!I shall deliver this letter myself.We cannot allow riffraff from the gutter to simply waltz into the chateau.
1�But I will take your name for the records, of course.
1� , is it?6Wait here.
1�You there!That letter of yours drained the color from Monarlais Halver's face!
1�Come with me!
1�Halt! You'd best have a good explanation why you're skulking about Chateau d'Oraguille, rabble.
1�A letter? Hand that over this instant!
1�I shall return in a moment.Wander not an ilm from where you stand!
1�Monarlais Halver will see you.To the castle with you at once, and no detours!
1�I'm sorry ?[Lord/Lady]  , but due to matters of security, I am not to allow anyone into the chateau until the Rites of Succession have taken place.
1�Hey! Who said you could go in? Get back here, scum!
1�The sender is...
1�Ahahaha!A member of the royal family would never have such abominable penmanship!
1�Ahahaha!A sage, you say? They write in characters that we simple folk cannot decipher...
1�Ahahaha!Well, we must do the mercenary's bidding now, mustn't we?
1�But if this letter is truly meant for Monarlais Halver as you say, then we must see that he receives it....
1�Father promised to take me fishing! But I know that he is a much greater swordsman than a fisher.
1�Now I shall prepare the #???? that you gave me.
1�You saw, did you not? My father is a mighty knight! I wish to become like him!
1�What? This is for me? You always give me things. Are you sure you do not want to use it to go fishing yourself, ?[sir/madam]?
1�Oh, actually, no...
1�I could not find any...
1�It's always like this.
1�Wow! Such a thing was inside its gizzard? Surely I would never have caught him, for he gave even you a run for your money.
1�Oh, I knew he would say no. Long ago, Father was not like this.
1�You see, my mother was killed by Orcs. My father was there, but he couldn't save her.
1�He blamed her death on the quality of his armor and weapons. He gave up practicing swordsmanship every morning, and spends all his time scouring the shops for equipment.
1�He is needed in the expeditions, but always he declines due to a supposed sickness or insufficiencies in equipment. I fear he will lose his rank as captain.
1�I am sure a knight of my father's stature could soon get me  $????. How can I go fishing now?
1�Oh, %???? can only be found in the Crawlers' Nest. And such a quest is beyond me! I wonder how I could get one...
1�Say, you are a knight, aren't you? Do you not want to catch the great fish of legend for its treasure?
1�That's a fine knight! First we will need  $???? to get started. I doubt my father would give one up if we asked.
1�What? How can you say that without even trying? After all, your opponent is a mere fish...
1�Good day. You are becoming quite a knight!
1�Why, hello, Vilbert!
1�You've returned from smiting Orcs, haven't you? Please, tell me of your adventures!
1�Yes. ?[He/She] went to great lengths to help me while you were away.
1�Vilbert is in the same division as my father.
1�Strange, that is... My father is well.
1�At any rate, Vilbert is a great swordsman. He last won second place at the tournament!
1�Greetings, Zarnei-Hamnei. What is it?
1�Truly? I begged a thousand times, yet always the answer was no.
1�Condition?
1�What? You ask the impossible! How is a child like me supposed to catch  $?????
1�I don't know...
1�Of course! They say he often swallows pieces of treasure. We won't stop until he is ours!
1�But therein lies a secret. We'll never tell where he bites, lest others catch him first!
1�Oh, yes. You are right. I shall ask him.
1�Wow, someday I wish to be a knight like him!
1�I wish I could tell you where 6???? is inside the caves. Try asking someone who often sharpens blades.
1�Would you please do me this favor?
1�I need 6???? from Ordelle's Caves. I must have it in order to sharpen a certain sword.
1�What do you say?I'll do my best.I can't right now.
1�Wonderful! I wish I could tell you where it could be found. Try asking someone who often sharpens blades.
1�That is all right. I have troubled you enough. Perhaps I will ask someone else.
1�Thank you. Here, this is for you. I snatched it from my father's chest. He won't notice if one goes missing. And besides, I'll be sharpening this blade for him!
1�Thank you for the fishing rod! By the way, there is something else I wish to ask of you.
1�I need 6???? from Ordelle's Caves. I must have it in order to sharpen a certain sword.
1�Oh, how I wish that Father was more like Vilbert. He wouldn't give one up, even if I asked.
1�What? You caught the big one? Amazing! I doubt I could have done the same.
1�Now, hurry and get it cleaned! I have heard of an expert fisherman in Selbina. You should find him and ask him!
1�What? Vilbert is in league with the Orcs? Hah! What nonsense!
1�I will not fall for such a joke so easily. Vilbert is taking me fishing in Jugner Forest. Be not surprised if I catch a bigger fish than the big one!
1�I will never get there, so let me tell you where you can fish for the big one. They say he's in Castle Oztroja.
1�If you take a renowned fisherman with you, then you should offer him something. At the very least, you should give five %???? or so.
1�But if you are to fish for him yourself, you should catch him easily, as long as you've had a little practice. After all, fishing is all about patience!
1�If you do catch the big one, watch out! They say he's one feisty fish. Your skills in swordsmanship will be of greater use than those of fishing, I gather.
1�I have uncovered all of this, yet I cannot go myself. Please, ?[sir/madam], catch him in my stead!
1�You are returning it to me? Why, thank you! Now I can go fishing with my friends!
1�But please do not pity my father. He is kind sometimes.
1�Father, how could you forget this sword?
1�Oh, where could he be?
1�I-I came here with my father, and now he's g-gone!
1�My father is a knight! Today he's on holiday, and so we went out for a walk. B-but now...
1�M-my father is so proud of his knighthood, he's still in uniform today. He looks noble indeed, though his armor creaks with each step!
1�He's not wearing his helmet, though... We came through Victory Arch together but, but now...
1�What? Y-you found my father?
1�Fathe
1�B-but, Father...
1�B-but, Father! No...
1�F-Father... How could you!
1�No! Th-that's my fishing rod... Father!
1�No, Father! Don't leave m
1�Yes? Is there something you need?
1�Do you have a question?Not really.About your father...About your grandfather...
1�Father? He said he had business at the weaponseller's in the southern part of town.Are you an acquaintance of his?
1�He's so engrossed in his blades that he's not given me a swordfighting lesson in weeks!At this rate, I shall never become a knight...
1�I am loath to boast, but his knowledge of armor and weaponry is second to none in the Kingdom.Helbort often consults with him about rare orders.
1�You've heard of Grandfather? That does not surprise me.He was, after all, an angler of no small repute.

1�Why, in his younger days, he would rise at the crack of dawn, and hike through Jugner Forest to Lake Mechieume.There, he would lose himself in fishing until sunset. Remarkable devotion, is it not?
1�Oh, would that I could go on such a fishing trip with my own father!Alas, it seems he did not inherit Grandfather's love for the sport...
1�Ailbeche?
r?�Why, you milksop! Lose sight of your father and all you do is wail for the nearest stranger? Have you no shame?
1�Enough! You are Elvaan! I expect more from you! Understand?
1�I'll forge you into shape yet! Now, stand there till you get a hold of yourself!
e!�Let me apologize for my son. Please accept this in return for your time.
1�Quiet! I will not have my own son cry like a baby!
1�Can I interest you in some magical maps?
1�When you look at a map for your present area, you can see the lay of the land, as well as your current location.
1�Members of your party and alliance will appear on the map, too. Also, certain jobs let you find people and monsters from a distance.
1�They're especially handy because you can mark where you've been, and some people can mark them for you as well.
1�You haven't enough money, ?[sir/ma'am].

1�Weary traveler, come pray with us.
1�Here in the San d'Oria Cathedral, we devote our lives to helping people reach the shining gates of Paradise.
1�Should you wish to know more about Paradise, come to the vicasque's sermon. Much will be revealed.
1�Should you wish to hear the sermon, please prepare an offering of  $???? as proof of your faith.
1�You will need  $???? to bring the water. Please beseech the friar who stands thither.
1�May Paradise open its gates to you.
1�Admirable is your generosity, but this is not #???? .
1�The Cheval runs through East Ronfaure. Exit the city through the Eastgate, and head north until you come to a small bridge over the river.
1�Stand upon the bridge in peace... Then ??trade?? your #???? to draw the sacred water!
1�Once you have  $????, return to me, Miageau.
1�May Paradise open its gates to you.
1�Thank you. Sacred is the #???? you conveyed hither.
1�In testament to your devotion, I give you this #????. Through it, Altana's providence is yours.
1�May Paradise open its gates to you.
1�May Paradise open its gates to you.
1�You will need  $???? to bring the water. Please beseech the friar who stands thither.
1�May Paradise open its gates to you.

1�Ever heard of the elements, the most primal forms of energy? There are eight in all.
1�Behold, they are like a wheel, with arrows forming a circle. This shows how the myriad elements relate to one another.
1�They are like six serpents in a circle, each biting the tail of the one before it.
1�I will explain simply. Water puts out fire, whilst the heat of fire melts ice.
1�Ice blocks wind, whilst wind wears away at earth. Can you see it right there?
1�Earth steals energy from lightning, whilst lightning throws its bolts into water.
1�Light and darkness occupy the center. They are in mutual opposition, for one cannot be both at once.
1�Ah, yes! There's one more thing you should know: the elements are tied closely to the status of your health.
1�If you'd like to learn more, I am willing to continue.

1�Very good! Fire causes disease, ice paralysis, wind silence, earth petrification, lightning stun, and water poison.
1�Then there is charm, which is caused by light, whilst blindness, curse, and sleep are all the domain of darkness.
1�Therefore, armor and accessories that resist certain elements also help you avoid status ailments caused by those elements.

1�The basic rules of Brenner are as follows:
1�First, the participants divide into two teams. Each side's camp contains the same number of ??Flammen-Brenner.??
1�At the beginning of the match, half of each side's Flammen-Brenner will be ablaze with ??Flamme,?? or flame, while the other half will remain unlit.
1�Participants can seize a Flamme from the opposing side's Flammen-Brenner and carry it around the Isle.
1�The goal is to steal your opponent's Flamme and use them to light your side's Flammen-Brenner.
1�The side that succeeds in lighting all of its Flammen-Brenner will be declared the winner after a specified amount of time.
1�If neither side is victorious before the match ends, the outcome will be judged based on the score. The ??match score?? section of the rulebook contains more information on this subject.
1�Brenner is significantly divided into public and private matches. Official matches are held periodically according to level and feature general participation.
1�You cannot reserve the Isle when an official match is being held.
1�No items are necessary for participation, but a minor fee will be collected. You will be unable to participate if your level is too low.

1�The match outcome will be recorded unless the number of participants fails to exceed 
� members, or if there are fewer than 
 members in a match where the two sides' numbers differ. In such cases, the game will be considered a training match and will not be recorded.
1�Private matches require a reservation, and participation may be limited. The Master of Ceremonies (MC) can freely adjust the rules and control match proceedings.
1�??LS Liga?? is a form of private match. You can learn more about LS Liga by speaking to a Marshal.
1�A Flammen-Brenner is a device that contains a Flamme (flame). The Flammen-Brenner is covered by a grate that will open after taking a set amount of damage, exposing the Flamme.
1�The participants must utilize this chance to seize the Flamme before the grate recloses. Once the grate is closed, the Flammen-Brenner will begin recovering from the damage it has been dealt.
1�If you manage to open the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner and capture their Flamme, you should make haste to light one of the Flammen-Brenner on your side.
1�After a certain amount of time, the Flamme will burn out and the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner will be relit.
1�Also, please note that you cannot quicken your pace using any special abilities while you are in possession of a Flamme.
1�In the event that neither side fulfills the conditions for victory, the outcome of the match will be evaluated based on score.

1�Ten points are awarded to each side for every lit Flammen-Brenner, while one point is awarded whenever a Flamme is captured, used to light a Flammen-Brenner, or recaptured from an opponent. One point is also awarded for protecting the Flammen-Brenner for a certain period of time.
1�Like Ballista, quarry (/quarry) can be used while playing Brenner. Participants may use this ability to dig up Petras and temporary items.
1�However, unlike Ballista Petras, Brenner Petras have no effect on the match score. You can trade a Petra to a Pursuivant to recover your HP and MP at no expense to TP.
1�Sprint cannot be used while carrying a Petra. Also, please note that the scout ability cannot be used in Brenner.
1�Petras will be lost in the event of a KO, but can be carried over from one match to another.
1�The sprint (/sprint) ability can be used to increase the player's speed when not in possession of a Flamme or Petras.
1�In the event of a KO, you will be returned to your team's camp. However, recovery will take longer the more often you fall in battle.
1�In other words, you will receive a penalty if you fall immediately after recovering from KO. In addition, your TP will be reduced to zero and you will lose any Petras in your possession.
1�When in possession of the key item 3????, temporary items will be automatically added to the player's inventory when quarried.

1�It was, in fact, a meeting to improve the failing relations between the cathedrals of San d'Oria and Tavnazia.

1�In particular, there seemed to be no end to the unsavory rumors surrounding the Tavnazian Cathedral. This was perhaps due to the strict policy of secrecy the Tavnazians had adopted following the period of internecine conflict in San d'Oria.

1�This story finds its beginning almost five hundred years ago...It reaches back to an era considered to be a time of humiliation for the Elvaan.
1�At that time, the Quon continent was under the control of an army dispatched by the Federation of Windurst.
1�The Elvaan race had yet to form a nation of their own, and the numerous tribes lived in forests apart from one another.
1�But even as now, the blood of the Elvaan ran deep with pride.Swearing victory upon his sword, the hero Lanfeaur d'Oraguille came forth to lead our people to freedom.
1�Along with General Alphollon Tajeux, who was later to become the Marquis of Tavnazia, they founded a kingdom on the strength of two valuable artifacts.
1�However, after the battle to emancipate the Elvaan, both of these treasures were lost.
1�In their respective places in the cathedrals of San d'Oria and Tavnazia, two mysterious stone tablets were left behind.
1�We toiled long and hard to solve the riddles of the tablets, and were finally able to retrieve one of the objects in the age of King Ranperre--the holy sword, Lightbringer.

1�A secret investigation instigated by the San d'Orian Cathedral discovered the writings upon the stone were actually the verses of a song.

1�The Tavnazian Cathedral had deciphered the words, but the melody yet eluded them.The search for one who could perform the song was apparently long and arduous.
1�However, when you appeared and were able to sing the opening verse, the song showed its first promise of power.

1�Venture roll is a competitive game played with dice similar to those used by corsairs. The objective is to roll until your cumulative total comes as close to 11 as possible without going over.

1�Until you reach or go over 11, you may continue rolling (doubling up) as many times as the table time limit allows (
  ? [minute/minutes], Earth time).
1�In addition to doubling up, you may also decline to roll the dice and stay with your current total (hold fast).
1�If your total ever goes over 11, you will automatically lose the game, regardless of the totals of other players. Knowing the right time to hold fast is one of the keys to staying in the match.

1�Once all the players have held fast, the game is over and the results are announced. The player closest to 11 is declared the winner and receives all the gil in the pot (the original participation fees of all the players).
1�Objective: Roll a six-sided die as many times as necessary to achieve a total as close to 11 as possible. You lose the instant your total exceeds 11.
1�If two or more players are the closest to 11 at the end of a match, the game is considered a draw and all participation fees are repaid in full.
1�Once the game has started, fees will not be refunded for any reason unless the match results in a draw.

1�The synergy furnaces you see around town are provided as a public service by the Bastokan Institute of Synergy Research, to ensure that no synergist is ever far away from the tools of their trade.
1�The synergist must provide his or her own 3????, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.Synergy furnaces themselves may be used free of charge.

1�You may think of synergy as an evolved form of synthesis.It is a discipline full of heretofore unimagined possibilities, but one which demands consummate skill from its practitioners.

1�Like synthesis, synergy involves combining materials according to a prescribed recipe to yield oft-spectacular results.The rub is that each synergy recipe also dictates a certain elemental balance that must be achieved for the procedure to be successful.

1�This balance is achieved through skillful infusion of combustible elemental crystals that we synergists call ??fewell.??To begin the synergy process, you'll have to feed the furnace with fewell and get those flames burning!
